content.question: An ideal gas with temperature <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math> and pressure <math alttext="P sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math> is sealed in a container with a movable piston. The piston is then slowly compressed so that the volume of the gas is reduced to half the original volume while the temperature of the gas is constant. Which of the following choices correctly compares the pressure <math alttext="P sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mstyle></math> of the gas at the new volume to the original pressure <math alttext="P sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub f is less than P sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="P sub f equals P sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub f is greater than P sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math>
The pressures cannot be compared without knowing the number of moles of gas in the container.

content.answer: <math alttext="P sub f is greater than P sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math>
